intro: Myrsine inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by small, fleshy berries. Myrsine inaequalis typically grows as an understory shrub in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
